captures.author: @jumperz
captures.text: your moltbot memory is broken and you probably don't realize it. a bigger context window isn't the fix but checkpoints are.. here's how it works: at whatever interval you set, the agent pauses, checks what it learned, and writes to persistent memory files, then keeps going.
captures.whyInteresting: Agent memory checkpoint pattern - exactly what we do with SESSION-STATE.md

captures.author: @arrakis_ai
captures.text: holy sht.. February is going to be insane. 12 major AI drops rumored/expected in the next 30 days: DeepSeek V4, ByteDance Doubao 2.0, Alibaba Qwen 3.5, Kling 3.0, Seedance 2.0, GPT-5.3, Grok 4.20, Claude 4.6, Gemini 3 GA, Apple Gemini-powered Siri, Meta Avocado

captures.author: @max_spero_
captures.text: Pretty cool project on /r/localllama - they take human written text and sloppify it 10x with 4o-mini, then train the model to de-slop by reversing the transformation

captures.author: @RohunJauhar
captures.text: my clawdbot browses my x feed everyday and improves itself on its own. here's the setup: everyone builds ai assistants the same way. you ask, it answers. that's just a chatbot with extra steps. i did something different. told my assistant to browse my x feed every night, find...

captures.author: @Afinetheorem
captures.text: Why skilled workers benefit more from AI tools at frontier (contra RCTs on well specified tasks): I bet 99.9% of the people I talk to at orgs on AI have no idea what Boris - lead of CC team - means by worktree, so won't know how to use AI this way.
captures.whyInteresting: Insight on AI productivity: skilled workers get more benefit because they know advanced techniques

captures.whyInteresting: Claude + n8n workflow automation with self-debugging loop

captures.author: @daveholtz
captures.text: the 'i'm probably taking this too seriously' first draft of a working paper analyzing the growth, structure, and conversation dynamics of @moltbook, the social network for AI agents ðŸ¦ž tl;dr: agents post a LOT but don't really talk to each other. 93.5% of comments get zero replies
captures.whyInteresting: Academic analysis of Moltbook - 93.5% of agent comments get zero replies. Fascinating data.

captures.author: @MarioNawfal
captures.text: Someone just built Moltroad, a straight-up marketplace where AI agents list and trade shady stuff: stolen identities, leaked API keys, prompt exploits, even 'memory wipe' services. Credits, ratings, live activity feed. Like a darknet, but for agents.
captures.whyInteresting: Agent darknet marketplace emerging - security implications for agent ecosystem

captures.author: @TheAhmadOsman
captures.text: the whole reason to self host IS TO USE A LOCAL LLM so your API keys, passwords, emails, calendar, health records, business data, and everything else are not sent to an API provider like OpenAI, OpenRouter, or Anthropic. Mac minis are NOT GOOD for that, BUT A GPU IS. Buy a GPU
captures.whyInteresting: Hot take on self-hosting: GPU > Mac mini for truly local/private AI
